content.title: Loop Quantum Gravity: Discrete Spacetime at the Planck Scale
content.abstract: Loop Quantum Gravity (LQG) is a non-perturbative, background-independent approach to quantum gravity that predicts spacetime geometry is quantized at the Planck scale. Area and volume operators have discrete spectra with minimum eigenvalues related to ℓ_P², providing one of the most concrete realizations of Planck-scale physics.

statement.text: Loop Quantum Gravity quantizes general relativity non-perturbatively, leading to a discrete spectrum for geometric operators. The area operator has eigenvalues A_j = 8πγℓ_P²√(j(j+1)) for half-integer j, giving a minimum non-zero area ~ γℓ_P². This represents genuine quantum discreteness of spacetime geometry at the Planck scale.
statement.volume_spectrum: V discrete with eigenvalues ~ ℓ_P³ (more complex formula)
statement.immirzi_parameter: γ ≈ 0.2375 (fixed by black hole entropy calculation)

explanation.intuition: Imagine spacetime not as a smooth continuum but as a network of discrete 'atoms' connected by links. In LQG, these atoms are represented by 'spin networks'—graphs where each link carries a quantum number (spin j = 0, 1/2, 1, ...) representing a quantum of area. Surfaces passing through links acquire area from the spins they intersect. The minimum possible area comes from the smallest non-zero spin j = 1/2, giving A_min ~ ℓ_P². Below this scale, 'area' has no meaning—it's not that we can't measure it, but that smaller areas simply don't exist as quantum states.
explanation.key_insight: LQG makes Planck-scale discreteness a mathematical theorem, not an assumption. Starting from Einstein's general relativity and applying canonical quantization (no new physics added!), the area and volume operators turn out to have discrete spectra. This is like angular momentum in QM: L² has eigenvalues ℓ(ℓ+1)ℏ² with no input about discreteness—it emerges from the math. Similarly, in LQG, geometric discreteness emerges from quantizing GR's constraint algebra.
explanation.technical_details: LQG reformulates GR using Ashtekar-Barbero variables: a self-dual SU(2) connection A and its conjugate densitized triad E. Holonomies of A around loops and fluxes of E through surfaces are well-defined operators. The Hilbert space is spanned by spin network states |Γ, j, i⟩ where Γ is a graph, j_e are spins on edges, i_v are intertwiners at vertices. Area operator: A_S = 8πγℓ_P² Σ_e √(j_e(j_e+1)) where sum is over edges intersecting surface S. Volume operator: more complex, acts at vertices, has discrete spectrum with gap ~ ℓ_P³. Dynamics encoded in Hamiltonian constraint—still being researched. Spin foam models provide covariant/path-integral formulation. Key results: (1) Area gap ~ γℓ_P² confirmed. (2) Volume gap exists but harder to compute. (3) Consistent black hole entropy: S_BH = A/(4ℓ_P²) reproduced with γ ~ 0.2375. (4) Singularity resolution in loop quantum cosmology—Big Bounce replaces Big Bang.
common_misconceptions: WRONG: 'LQG assumes discrete spacetime' — Discreteness EMERGES from quantizing GR's constraints
WRONG: 'Spin networks are a lattice' — Networks are abstract graphs in superposition, not fixed lattice
WRONG: 'LQG is proven to be correct' — It's a candidate theory with predictions not yet tested
WRONG: 'Area quantum is exactly ℓ_P²' — It's ~ γℓ_P² with Immirzi parameter γ ~ 0.2375
WRONG: 'LQG and string theory are incompatible' — They may describe different aspects or regimes
CORRECT: 'LQG predicts discrete geometry' — Area/volume operators have discrete eigenvalues

spin_networks.definition: Graph with edges labeled by SU(2) spins (j = 0, 1/2, 1, ...) and vertices by intertwiners
spin_networks.interpretation: Quantum state of spatial geometry; edges represent quanta of area
spin_networks.history: Introduced by Penrose (1971), adopted in LQG by Rovelli & Smolin (1995)

spin_foams.definition: 2-complexes with faces labeled by spins, providing histories of spin networks
spin_foams.interpretation: Path integral for LQG; spacetime histories between initial and final spin networks
spin_foams.models: Barrett-Crane, EPRL/FK, and other specific spin foam models

holonomy.definition: Parallel transport of connection around a loop: h_γ = P exp(∮ A)
holonomy.interpretation: Fundamental variable in LQG; well-defined on discontinuous connections

immirzi_parameter.definition: Free parameter in Ashtekar-Barbero connection formulation
immirzi_parameter.significance: Sets the area gap: A_min ~ γℓ_P²

physical_predictions.status: Mathematical result; no direct experimental test

physical_predictions.property: Volume operator at graph vertices has discrete eigenvalues
physical_predictions.gap: V_min ~ ℓ_P³ (roughly, actual formula more complex)
physical_predictions.status: Mathematical result; harder to compute than area

physical_predictions.result: S_BH = A/(4ℓ_P²) recovered with correct coefficient
physical_predictions.method: Counting spin network states piercing horizon

physical_predictions.description: Loop quantum cosmology replaces Big Bang singularity with bounce
physical_predictions.mechanism: Quantum geometry repulsion at Planck density
physical_predictions.status: Theoretical; may leave imprints in CMB

physical_predictions.description: Discrete geometry may affect photon propagation
physical_predictions.constraint: Fermi LAT gamma-ray observations constrain effects
physical_predictions.status: Not observed; LQG effects may be too small

vs_string_theory.strings: Perturbative; requires extra dimensions; predicts continuous spacetime with minimum length
vs_string_theory.lqg: Non-perturbative; works in 4D; predicts discrete geometry
vs_string_theory.common: Both predict Planck-scale modifications to spacetime

vs_causal_sets.causal_sets: Discrete spacetime assumed from start; random sprinkling of points
vs_causal_sets.lqg: Discreteness emerges from quantization; structured spin networks

vs_asymptotic_safety.asymptotic_safety: Gravity is well-behaved at high energies; no discreteness required
vs_asymptotic_safety.relation: Possibly compatible or describing different regimes

open_problems: Dynamics: Solving the Hamiltonian constraint fully
Continuum limit: Recovering smooth GR at large scales
Matter coupling: Including Standard Model consistently
Semiclassical states: Finding states approximating classical spacetimes
Observables: Constructing complete set of Dirac observables
Lorentz invariance: Ensuring no violations in continuum limit

definitions_glossary.loop_quantum_gravity: Non-perturbative, background-independent quantization of general relativity predicting discrete geometry
definitions_glossary.spin_network: Graph labeled by SU(2) spins representing quantum state of spatial geometry
definitions_glossary.spin_foam: 2-complex providing spacetime history/evolution of spin networks
definitions_glossary.area_gap: Minimum non-zero eigenvalue of area operator ~ γℓ_P²
definitions_glossary.immirzi_parameter: γ ≈ 0.2375, free parameter fixing physical scale of LQG
definitions_glossary.holonomy: Parallel transport around loop; fundamental LQG variable
definitions_glossary.intertwiner: SU(2) invariant tensor at spin network vertex coupling incident spins
definitions_glossary.hamiltonian_constraint: Wheeler-DeWitt equation in LQG form; generates dynamics

Confusing spin networks with a fixed lattice
Missing the role of Immirzi parameter γ

Discreteness emerges—it's not assumed a priori

Big Bounce replaces Big Bang singularity in loop quantum cosmology
